alert.note: Alert for Cimarron (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 9:27PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Cimarron County through 1000 PM CDT... At 927 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Boise City, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Boise City and Keyes. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for the Panhandle of Oklahoma.
